TITLE: As Klarna and Affirm falter, a new breed of 'buy now, pay later' startups are stealing the spotlight
SUMMARY: Venture capitalists are betting a new breed of startups from Europe will be the real winners in the crowded "buy now, pay later" space.

TITLE: Maine insurance agency faces online backlash after racist Juneteenth sign
SUMMARY: The Harry E. Reed Insurance Agency of Millinocket, Maine, is facing criticism for posting a racist sign on Juneteenth.

TITLE: Microsoft finds Gen Z is redefining the idea of work hustle in and outside the office
SUMMARY: Recent Gen Z college graduates are flipping the career paradigm and pursuing entrepreneurship rather than entering the corporate world.

TITLE: Brex drops tens of thousands of small business customers as Silicon Valley adjusts to new reality
SUMMARY: The move is the latest sign of a sea change occurring among start-ups as an abrupt shift in market conditions is forcing a new discipline on companies.

TITLE: Meet this entrepreneur who saved $100,000 and quit her marketing job by age 25. Here's how she did it
SUMMARY: Millennial Tori Dunlap landed an entry-level marketing job after college and learned that the corporate life wasn't for her. Here's how she planned an exit.

TITLE: For Americans behind on saving for retirement, a bad stock market can be a good time to invest more
SUMMARY: Stock market volatility is an opportunity for small business owners, often the farthest behind in long-term savings goals, to contribute to a retirement plan.

TITLE: Walgreens, Amazon and Wawa find success with the most-overlooked unemployed worker
SUMMARY: Neurodiverse adults with conditions including autism, ADHD, dyspraxia, dyslexia are finding jobs at businesses large and small, and are an untapped labor pool.

TITLE: Here's why major cities may still be worth their high cost of living
SUMMARY: Cities' longstanding and dominant business advantages have waned in the pandemic but not disappeared amid wide adoption of remote work.

TITLE: America's small businesses aren't ready for a cyberattack
SUMMARY: Small business owners consistently leave cybersecurity off their list of top risks. The level of threat is higher than they think, and customers are worried.

TITLE: In the fight against climate change, seaweed could be a surprising — but vital — weapon
SUMMARY: Seaweed is found in everything from food and cosmetics to gardening products and packaging.

TITLE: From baker to entrepreneur, how this high-school grad built up his $100,000 business
SUMMARY: Justin Ellen decided to not pursue college and focus on his baking business full-time. CNBC Make It finds out why that has paid off for the 19-year-old.

TITLE: For President Biden’s approval rating to go up, it’s obvious what needs to go down
SUMMARY: Presidents get credit for a strong economy in good times and blame for a struggling economy during bad times, as Biden is experiencing now due to inflation.

TITLE: Meet a human trafficking survivor who built her own business with $400
SUMMARY: You can start a successful business with little to no capital. That's human trafficking survivor Nakia Vestal's story. Watch this video to see how she did it.

TITLE: ‘We are being squeezed in every direction’ – As inflation grips small businesses, here’s how they are responding
SUMMARY: Some 75% of small business owners are experiencing a rise in the cost of their supplies, yet only 40% are increasing prices, a CNBC survey found.

TITLE: Stacey Abrams on why companies shouldn't always speak out on political issues
SUMMARY: Stacey Abrams, Georgia governor candidate, is a star of the Democratic Party, but as a business owner she says speaking out on politics isn't always right.

TITLE: Why the market is taking Powell's 'soft-ish' economic language so hard: Former Fed official Roger Ferguson
SUMMARY: Inflation may go down, but isn't going away, and the markets and economy will be 'rocky' for up to two years, says former Fed official Roger Ferguson.

TITLE: Main Street is convinced that a recession will hit the U.S. economy this year
SUMMARY: Eight in ten small business owners across the U.S. tell CNBC that they expect the economy to enter a recession this year.

TITLE: How small businesses can avoid financial missteps in an inflationary environment
SUMMARY: As inflation hits highs not seen in decades, here's a look at how small business owners can avoid financial flubs that could set them back.

TITLE: How to get a free pair of Nike sneakers and other life hacks
SUMMARY: Understanding all the details before you buy something can lead to surprising upsides — like a new pair of Nike sneakers or getting $400 off an Apple computer.

TITLE: Major retailers boost Black female entrepreneurship as employment gap lingers
SUMMARY: Ulta, Sephora and Target have created entrepreneurial diversity programs, providing mentorship, financial support and new business opportunities.

TITLE: Medical spas are seeing a boost in beauty procedures as people emerge from two pandemic years at home
SUMMARY: Specializing in aesthetic services, medspas across the country have been seeing a rise in robust treatment plans for both face and body in the past year.

TITLE: How to launch a start-up while you're still in college
SUMMARY: College is a great time to try your hand at starting a business, when you have a lot of support and a built-in customer base. Here are a few starter tips.

TITLE: With Russian sanctions, small companies may be in for a big surprise
SUMMARY: Small business owners may assume they have no risk of doing business with sanctioned Russian clients. In a digital economy and start-up boom, that's a mistake.

TITLE: 5 money-saving tips from a TikTok lawyer who reads the fine print
SUMMARY: Reading the fine print means you could save money, according to Erika Kullberg, lawyer and founder of Plug and Law.

TITLE: Big food automation is making its way to Main Street's menu
SUMMARY: From restaurants to packaged food makers, software automation and robots are beginning to play a bigger role in small business economic decisions.

TITLE: Main Street's minority owners need loans to grow, but access to capital remains inequitable
SUMMARY: Black-owned small businesses are growing, and can tap SBA loans, but access to capital from banks is a hurdle and securing banking relationships is critical.

TITLE: How this mechanic found a niche fixing Teslas and EVs
SUMMARY: Carl Medlock used to work at Tesla, now he runs his own repair shop in Seattle fixing electric vehicles.

TITLE: The congressional spending bill battle had a not-so-great message for small businesses
SUMMARY: A majority of small business owners support more relief from the government, according to the CNBC|SurveyMonkey Small Business Survey. Don't count on it.

TITLE: The 30-year-old female founder at the forefront of a billion-dollar bet on CRISPR gene editing
SUMMARY: Nathan Chen’s sister Janice co-founded Mammoth Biosciences while watching her brother skate in the Olympics. Her plan: get the CRISPR start-up to $100 billion.

TITLE: Here’s how urban and rural Americans build wealth differently
SUMMARY: There are key differences between rural and urban Americans when it comes to building wealth. Here's how it may affect retirement.
